Welcome to CoPhil EO AI/ML Training

Pre-Course Orientation & Setup Guide

Instructor

EU-Philippines CoPhil Programme

Date

January 1, 2025

Welcome!

About This Training

4-Day Advanced Programme

  • AI/ML for Earth Observation
  • Online delivery
  • Hands-on focused
  • Philippine context

Focus Areas

  • Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR)
  • Climate Change Adaptation (CCA)
  • Natural Resource Management (NRM)

Welcome to the CoPhil 4-Day Advanced Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation. This is an intensive, hands-on programme designed specifically for Philippine EO professionals.

Course Overview

Day 1: EO Data & AI/ML Fundamentals
Day 2: Machine Learning (Random Forest & CNNs)
Day 3: Advanced Deep Learning
Day 4: Applications & Project Work

Total: 32 hours of training + self-paced exercises

The course is structured to progress from fundamentals to advanced applications, with each day building on previous knowledge.

EU Global Gateway Initiative

Partnership for Progress

  • EU-Philippines space cooperation flagship
  • Building sustainable digital infrastructure
  • Strengthening research and education systems
  • Open data for societal benefit

This training is part of the EU Global Gateway Initiative, representing Europe’s commitment to building smart, clean, and secure partnerships worldwide.

CoPhil Programme

Mission

Support PhilSA and DOST to enhance use of Earth Observation data for disaster response, climate adaptation, and resource management.

Key Outputs

  • Copernicus Mirror Site
  • Digital Space Campus
  • Capacity building programmes
  • Pilot services development

CoPhil positions the Philippines as a pioneer in the EU’s international cooperation on Copernicus Earth Observation.

What You’ll Learn

Day 1: Foundations

  • Session 1 (2h): Copernicus Sentinel Data & Philippine EO Ecosystem
  • Session 2 (2h): Core Concepts of AI/ML for Earth Observation
  • Session 3 (2h): Hands-on Python for Geospatial Data
  • Session 4 (2h): Introduction to Google Earth Engine

Day 1 establishes the foundation you’ll need for the entire programme.

Day 2: Machine Learning

  • Session 1 (3h): Random Forest Theory & Practice
  • Session 2 (2h): Palawan Land Cover Classification Lab
  • Session 3 (2.5h): Introduction to Deep Learning & CNNs
  • Session 4 (2.5h): CNN Hands-on Lab with TensorFlow

Day 2 covers both traditional machine learning and introduces deep learning fundamentals.

Day 3: Advanced Deep Learning

  • Session 1: U-Net for Semantic Segmentation
  • Session 2: Object Detection for EO
  • Session 3: Time Series Analysis with RNNs
  • Session 4: Multi-modal Data Fusion

Day 3 explores advanced deep learning architectures for specialized EO tasks.

Day 4: Applications & Projects

  • Session 1: Model Deployment & MLOps
  • Session 2: Real-world Case Studies
  • Session 3: Capstone Project Work
  • Session 4: Presentations & Wrap-up

Day 4 brings everything together with practical applications and your own project work.

Technical Requirements

What You Need

✅ Required (FREE)

  1. Google Account (Gmail) for Colab access
  2. Google Earth Engine Account (sign up at earthengine.google.com)
  3. Stable Internet Connection (2 Mbps+ recommended)
  4. Modern Web Browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge - latest version)
  5. Computer/Laptop (4GB+ RAM recommended)

All tools we use are cloud-based and free. No software installation required!

Optional but Helpful

  • Google Drive with 5-10 GB free space (for saving outputs)
  • Dual monitors or large screen (easier for following along)
  • Headphones with microphone (better audio quality)
  • Note-taking app (OneNote, Notion, Evernote, paper!)

These aren’t strictly required but will enhance your learning experience.

Setup Instructions

Step 1: Google Account

If you have Gmail:

✅ You’re all set!

Just make sure you can access colab.research.google.com

If you don’t have Gmail:

  1. Go to accounts.google.com
  2. Click “Create account”
  3. Follow the prompts
  4. Verify your email

Most participants already have a Google account, but if not, it takes just 5 minutes to create one.

Step 2: Google Earth Engine

Sign Up Process

  1. Visit signup.earthengine.google.com
  2. Sign in with your Google account
  3. Fill out registration form:
    • ✅ Select “Non-commercial” use
    • ✅ Project type: “Education/Research”
    • ✅ Organization: Your agency (PhilSA, NAMRIA, DOST, University, etc.)
  4. Submit and wait for approval email (usually 1-2 days)

⚠️ Do this NOW if you haven’t already!

GEE approval can take 24-48 hours, so sign up immediately. We’ll need it for Sessions 4, Day 2, and beyond.

Step 3: Test Google Colab

Quick Test

  1. Go to colab.research.google.com
  2. Click “New Notebook”
  3. In the first cell, type:
print("Hello, CoPhil Training!")
  1. Press Shift+Enter to run
  2. You should see the output below the cell

✅ If you see “Hello, CoPhil Training!” — you’re ready!

Colab is where we’ll do all our hands-on work. Make sure it works before Day 1.

Step 4: Join Course Platforms

Access the Course Site

  • Zoom/Meeting Link: [Will be sent before each session]

📧 Check your email for access links and calendar invites

We’ll share all access information via email before the course begins.

Course Format

Daily Schedule

Time Activity Format
09:00-11:00 Session 1 Lecture + Demo
11:00-11:15 ☕ Break -
11:15-13:00 Session 2 Lecture + Demo
13:00-14:00 🍱 Lunch -
14:00-16:00 Session 3 Hands-on Lab
16:00-16:15 ☕ Break -
16:15-18:00 Session 4 Hands-on Lab

Each day follows this consistent schedule. Plan your day accordingly and protect this time.

Session Structure

Typical 2-Hour Session

  • 10 min: Introduction & objectives
  • 60 min: Core content
  • 40 min: Hands-on exercises OR Q&A
  • 10 min: Summary & next steps

We balance theory with practice. You’ll spend roughly 50% of time doing hands-on work.

Learning Methods

Instructor-Led

  • Presentations
  • Code examples
  • Guided exercises
  • Real-time Q&A

Self-Paced

  • Jupyter notebooks
  • Practice exercises
  • Optional challenges
  • Take-home assignments

Blended approach: Learn together, practice at your own pace

We combine live instruction with self-paced practice for maximum flexibility and learning.

Expectations & Etiquette

During Live Sessions

✅ Please DO:

  • Keep your camera on (when possible) — builds community
  • Ask questions via chat or unmute
  • Share your screen if you need help
  • Participate in polls and exercises
  • Take breaks when scheduled

Active participation makes the training more engaging for everyone.

During Live Sessions

⛔ Please AVOID:

  • Multitasking (emails, other work) — you’ll miss key concepts
  • Eating during lectures (breaks are scheduled)
  • Side conversations on unmuted mics
  • Recording without permission
  • Sharing course materials publicly (check license)

Respect everyone’s learning experience and focus on the material.

Code of Conduct

  • Respectful: All questions are welcome
  • Collaborative: Help your fellow participants
  • Professional: Maintain work-appropriate language and behavior
  • Inclusive: Value diverse perspectives and experiences
  • Curious: Embrace mistakes as learning opportunities

We’re all here to learn together! 🌟

This is a supportive learning environment. Everyone starts somewhere, and questions help everyone learn.

Getting Help

During Sessions

Technical Issues

  • Share your screen
  • Describe the error
  • Check chat for solutions
  • Use breakout rooms

Conceptual Questions

  • Ask in chat anytime
  • Unmute and ask verbally
  • Use Q&A sessions

Don’t suffer in silence! We’re here to help you succeed.

Outside of Sessions

Support Resources

  1. Email Support: skotsopoulos@neuralio.ai
  2. Office Hours: [Schedule TBA]
  3. Peer Study Groups: Connect with other participants

Response time: Usually within 24 hours

We provide multiple channels for support. Use whatever works best for you.

Materials & Resources

What You’ll Receive

  • 📊 Presentation Slides (all sessions)
  • 📓 Jupyter Notebooks (with exercises and solutions)
  • 📚 Handouts & Cheat Sheets
  • 📁 Sample Datasets (Philippine examples)
  • 🔗 Resource Links (documentation, tutorials, papers)
  • 🎓 Certificate (upon completion)

All materials are yours to keep and use after the course.

Accessing Materials

During the Course

  • Course Website: Browse all content
  • GitHub Repository: Download notebooks and code
  • Google Drive: Shared datasets and resources

After the Course

  • Materials remain accessible for 6 months
  • Fork/clone GitHub repository for permanent access
  • Download everything you need before access expires

Make sure to download materials you want to keep permanently.

Assessment & Certificate

Completion Requirements

To receive your certificate, you must:

  1. ✅ Attend at least 75% of live sessions (24/32 hours)
  2. ✅ Complete hands-on exercises (Day 1-3)
  3. ✅ Submit capstone project (Day 4)
  4. ✅ Fill out feedback survey (end of course)

The certificate documents your participation and skill development.

Capstone Project

Final Day Project

  • Individual or Team: Your choice (teams of 2-3)
  • Topic: Philippine DRR/CCA/NRM application
  • Duration: 3-4 hours work time
  • Deliverable: 10-min presentation + Jupyter notebook
  • Assessment: Peer review + instructor feedback

Goal: Apply everything you’ve learned to a real problem

The capstone lets you demonstrate your new skills on a problem relevant to your work.

Prerequisites & Preparation

What You Should Know

✅ Required Knowledge

  • Python Basics: Variables, lists, loops, functions
  • Remote Sensing Concepts: Bands, resolution, spectral signatures
  • Basic Statistics: Mean, standard deviation, correlation

Don’t worry! We’ll review Python basics in Day 1, Session 3

We assume you have basic Python knowledge. If you’re rusty, review before the course.

What You DON’T Need to Know

❌ NOT Required

  • Advanced math (linear algebra, calculus) — we explain intuitively
  • Deep learning experience — we teach from scratch
  • Google Earth Engine — we start with basics
  • Specific ML libraries — we’ll install and introduce everything

We teach what you need when you need it!

This is an introductory course. We don’t expect prior ML or GEE experience.

Recommended Pre-Work

📚 Optional Reading

If you want a head start:

  1. Python Refresh: Python for Beginners
  2. Remote Sensing: Review Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 basics
  3. Colab Tutorial: Welcome to Colaboratory
  4. GEE Intro: Earth Engine guides

⏱️ Time: 2-3 hours total (optional!)

These are optional but can make Day 1 easier if you have time.

Tips for Success

Maximizing Your Learning

  1. Dedicate Time: Block your calendar, minimize distractions
  2. Take Notes: Write down key concepts and “aha” moments
  3. Practice Immediately: Run code as we demo it
  4. Ask Questions: No question is too basic
  5. Connect Concepts: Relate to your own work and data
  6. Experiment: Modify code, try variations, break things!
  7. Network: Connect with other participants
  8. Follow Up: Review materials after each session

Active learning beats passive watching every time.

Common Pitfalls to Avoid

⚠️ Watch Out For:

  • Rushing ahead: Follow along step-by-step
  • Copy-pasting without understanding: Read and modify code
  • Falling behind: Ask for help immediately
  • Skipping breaks: Your brain needs rest
  • Working in isolation: Collaborate and discuss

Learn from others’ mistakes. These are the most common issues we see.

Philippine Context

Why This Training Matters

Challenges

  • 20+ typhoons per year
  • Climate change impacts
  • Deforestation & biodiversity loss
  • Rapid urbanization
  • Food security

Solutions

  • Early warning systems
  • Land cover monitoring
  • Disaster response mapping
  • Agricultural monitoring
  • Coastal zone management

EO + AI/ML = Better decisions, faster response, lives saved

This isn’t just academic - these skills directly support Philippine resilience and development.

Philippine EO Ecosystem

Key Agencies

  • PhilSA: Philippine Space Agency (SIYASAT portal, Diwata missions)
  • NAMRIA: National mapping and geoportal
  • DOST-ASTI: AI platforms (SkAI-Pinas, PANDA, DIMER)
  • PAGASA: Weather forecasting and climate monitoring
  • DENR: Environmental management and forest monitoring
  • DA: Agricultural applications

You’ll learn to work with data and tools from these agencies throughout the course.

Course Examples Feature

  • Palawan land cover classification
  • Metro Manila flood mapping
  • Typhoon damage assessment
  • Coral reef health monitoring
  • Rice paddy mapping
  • Forest fire detection

Real data. Real problems. Real impact. 🇵🇭

Every example is chosen to be relevant to Philippine EO professionals.

Timeline & Next Steps

Before Day 1

✅ Action Items

  • NOW: Sign up for Google Earth Engine (takes 1-2 days for approval)
  • 1 Week Before: Test Colab, check equipment
  • 3 Days Before: Review Python basics (if needed)
  • 1 Day Before: Join course platforms, note Zoom links
  • Morning Of: Join 10 minutes early for tech check

Following this timeline ensures a smooth start on Day 1.
